result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sydney D Petty

defendant.name: Petty, Sydney D
defendant.address: 6101 N Green Bay Road #111, Glendale, WI 53209

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Acceptance to First Offender Program

[MK] case called at 9:41am. 
Defendant Sydney D Petty in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Huebner reports that Ms. Petty has been admitted into the First Offender Program; FOP paperwork is forthcoming. 
recess 9:42am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 1:43PM
Defendant Sydney D Petty in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Att Huebner advises that the Defendant is scheduled to proceed with the First Offender Program. ADA Teuber interjects, advising that the Defendant was scheduled for Intake, however the Defendant did not appear, and further attempts to contact the Defendant have been unsuccessful. 
The Court instructs the Defendant and Att Huebner to appear at the DA's Office after the conclusion of this hearing to verify contact information as well as schedule a new appointment.

recess 1:47PM

NEXT: Status Conference on10/31 at 9:30AM (this hearing will be removed from the Court's calendar if verification of FOP acceptance is received before the hearing date)
SPD Order Appointing Counsel - Att Huebner

Pre-trial conference on July 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Sydney D Petty
Current: 6101 N Green Bay Road #111, Glendale, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 06-28-2022)
Prior: 6101 N Green Bay Road #101, Glendale, WI 53209
--not to use financial or account information not in her name

[ma] Case called at 1:38 PM 
Defendant Sydney D Petty appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth; corrects address to Apt #111
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.


The Court requires a $1000  Signature Bond with condition:
--not to use financial or account information not in her name
recess 1:42 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/27/22 at 2:00pm   (2) Status Conference on 8/18/22 at 1:30pm

[MK] case called at 11:47am
Defendant Sydney D Petty not in court.  ADA Barbara Michaels appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Initial Appearance today. 
ADA Michaels indicates that the mailing of the Summons and Complaint was not returned by the postal service.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court issues a Probable Cause Warrant-body only. 
recess 11:48am.

Victim Witness Key
The original document name was titled: Victim Witness Key
The original history event date is: 01-18-2022
